Air Products 1/3 P r o f i l e 
Dual qualified German-English lawyer with 17 years energy industry experience in Germany, the UK 
and the Netherlands inter alia advising international energy companies inhouse in regulatory and 
government affairs. Additionally, five years’ experience in private practice in Germany and the UK with a 
Ph.D. in Law and Economics in European energy network regulation: 
 Comprehensive knowledge of and experience in the key issues of energy transition and in-depth 
expertise in the functioning of the electricity and gas markets, their design and regulation 
 Highly rated representation of stakeholder and company interests and interface in communications 
with regulatory agencies and state administration and experience in working with industry 
associations and in the area of political and corporate communications and lobbying 
 Successfully and reliably negotiating with regulatory agencies and monitoring, evaluating and 
communicating political and regulatory developments and their legislative implementation 
 Active networking and political engagement in various capacities in industry associations, business 
communities and the German Conservative Party; member of influential lobbying platforms in Berlin 
(such as the Forum for Future Energies) 
 Successfully managing special projects with multi-national and multi-disciplinary teams; strong 
background and experience in business administration 
 Trustfully advising executive and senior management and collaborating with business development 
and finance departments; successfully managing, reorganising and establishing legal and 
regulatory affairs teams 
 Appreciated as a person of integrity with persuasiveness, focus and quick comprehension, able to 
work independently and manage several threads and projects in parallel, responsible and diligent, 
team-minded, conciliatory and loyal

enercity Erneuerbare GmbH, Leer/Hannover, Germany

Director Government Affair s Germany and Legal Counsel

 Actively representing company interests in nuclear industry association KernD 
 Selected by German CEO Dr Thomas Haeberle (former member of executive board of Evonik); 
member of team of five headed by U.S. American Melissa Mann with other members from the U.S., 
the U.K. and the Netherlands
